title: 107_hr874
content:
The "Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001" is introduced, amending the 1986 Internal Revenue Code. It specifies that changes in tax rates under this Act will not be considered as changes in tax rates for certain purposes. Additionally, there is a reduction in marginal income tax rates for individuals. SEC. 2. REDUCTION IN MARGINAL INCOME TAX RATES FOR INDIVIDUALS. Amends Section 1 to impose reduced tax rates for married individuals filing jointly and surviving spouses based on taxable income. The tax rates for individuals based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $12,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $12,000 but not over $45,200: $1,680 plus 15% of the excess over $12,000
- Over $45,200 but not over $109,250: $6,660 plus 27% of the excess over $45,200
- Over $109,250 but not over $166,450: $23,953.50 plus 30% of the excess over $109,250
- Over $166,450 but not over $297,300: $41,113.50 plus 35% of the excess over $166,450
- Over $297,300: $86,911 plus 38% of the excess The tax rates for heads of households are as follows:
- Not over $12,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $12,000 but not over $45,200: $1,680 plus 15% of the excess
- Over $45,200 but not over $109,250: $6,660 plus 27% of the excess
- Over $109,250 but not over $166,450: $23,953.50 plus 30% of the excess
- Over $166,450 but not over $297,300: $41,113.50 plus 35% of the excess
- Over $297,300: $86,911 plus 38% of the excess "If taxable income is not over $10,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $10,000 but not over $36,250, the tax is $1,400 plus 15% of the excess. Income over $36,250 but not over $93,600 incurs a tax of $5,337.50 plus 27% of the excess. For income over $93,600 but not over $151,600, the tax is $20,822 plus 30% of the excess. Income over $151,600 but not over $297,300 is taxed at $38,222 plus 35% of the excess. Income over $297,300 is taxed at $89,217 plus 38% of the excess." The tax imposed on unmarried individuals (excluding surviving spouses and heads of households) is determined based on a table. For taxable income over $297,300, the tax is $89,217 plus 38% of the excess. For taxable income over $297,300, the tax is $91,945 plus 38% of the excess. For married individuals filing separate returns, a tax is imposed on taxable income based on a specific table. The tax rate is $91,945 plus 38% of the excess over $297,300. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $6,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $6,000 but not over $22,600: $840, plus 15% of the excess over $6,000
- Over $22,600 but not over $54,625: $3,330, plus 27% of the excess over $22,600
- Over $54,625 but not over $83,225: $11,976.75, plus 30% of the excess over $54,625
- Over $83,225 but not over $148,650: $20,556.75, plus 35% of the excess over $83,225
- Over $148,650: $43,455.50, plus 38% of the excess The tax rates for taxable income are as follows: 
- Over $148,650: $43,455.50, plus 38% of the excess
- Phasein of Rate Reductions: Tax rates imposed in taxable years beginning in 2002 are reduced gradually. The tax rates for taxable income are gradually reduced in taxable years after 2002 and before 2007, with adjustments made by the Secretary to the prescribed tables. The tax rates for taxable income are gradually reduced in taxable years after 2002 and before 2007, with adjustments made by the Secretary to the prescribed tables beginning in calendar year 2006. The Secretary will not adjust dollar amounts for tax rate brackets for taxable years after 2001 and before 2007. For years after 2006, adjustments will be made using a cost-of-living adjustment based on 2005 instead of 2000. The text chunk discusses amendments made by substituting '2005' for '2000' in various sections of the law. The text chunk contains various sections of the law that are being amended, including Section 25A, Section 42, and others. The text chunk includes multiple sections of the law being amended, such as changing percentages in various sections like 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) and 3402(p)(1)(B). The text chunk amends various sections by changing percentages, such as replacing "7, 15, 28, or 31 percent" with "5, 10, 15, or 25 percent" in section 3402(p)(1)(B). The Secretary of the Treasury may adjust these percentages to align with other specified tables. The text chunk specifies effective dates for the amendments made, with changes applying to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. Amendments to withholding provisions apply to amounts paid after the same date. Repeal of phaseouts of deduction for personal exemptions and itemized deductions. Repeal of Phaseout of Personal Exemptions, amending subsection (d) of section 151 by striking paragraph (3) and making technical amendments to section 1(f). Inflation adjustment for taxable years after 1989. The dollar amount in paragraph (1) is increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. Section 68, which imposed an overall limitation on itemized deductions, has been repealed along with related technical amendments. The amendments made by this section remove certain subparagraphs and clauses, as well as an item in the table of sections. These changes will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001.
